required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Celebrex In Acute Gouty Arthritis Study
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Randomized, Double-Blind, Multicenter, Active-Controlled Trial To Evaluate The Efficacy And Safety Of Celecoxib (Celebrex®) And Indomethacin In The Treatment Of Moderate To Severe Acute Gouty Arthritis

brief_summary.textblock: This is a multicenter, double-blind, double-dummy, randomized, active-controlled study that will include an 8-day treatment period followed by a 1-week follow-up period in patients experiencing symptoms of an acute exacerbation of gouty arthritis.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Day 2 in Patient's Assessment of Pain Intensity
primary_outcome.description: The Patient's Pain Intensity in the Index Joint for the prior 24 hours was assessed by completion of the following 5 point scale: My pain over the past 24 hours has been: None (0), Mild (1), Moderate (2), Severe (3), or Extreme (4).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Physician's Assessment of the Index Joint on Days 5, 9, and 14/Early Termination: Tenderness
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Day 5, Day 9, and Day 14/Early Termination
secondary_outcome.description: Tenderness was assessed on the basis of palpation or passive motion using a 4 point scale with the following ratings: the patient had no tenderness (0), the patient complained of pain (1), the patient complained of pain and winced (2) and the patient complained of pain, winced, and withdrew (3).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Physician's Assessment of the Index Joint on Days 5, 9, and 14/Early Termination: Swelling
secondary_outcome.description: Swelling was assessed using a 4 point scale with the following ratings: none (0), palpable (1), visible (2), and bulging beyond joint margins (3)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Redness Present According to Physician's Assessment of the Index Joint on Day 5, Day 9, and Day 14/Early Termination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Day 5, Day 9 and Day 14/Early Termination
secondary_outcome.description: Redness was assessed by the physician as present or absent.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Warmth Present According to Physician's Assessment of the Index Joint on Day 5, Day 9, and Day 14
secondary_outcome.description: Warmth was assessed by the physician as present or absent.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Patient's Assessment of Pain Intensity
secondary_outcome.description: The Patient's assessment of pain for the prior 24 hours was assessed by completion of the following 5 point scale: My pain over the past 24 hours has been: None (0), Mild (1), Moderate, (2), Severe (3), and Extreme (4).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Patient's Assessment of Pain Intensity on Day 1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 2, 4, 8, 12 hours postdose Day 1, Day 2 (24 hours and 32 hours post first dose)
secondary_outcome.description: The patient's assessment of pain was assessed by completion of the following 5 point scale: my pain at this time is none (0), mild (1), moderate, (2), severe (3), and extreme (4).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Time Weighted Average of Patient's Assessment of Pain Intensity Over 8, 12, and 24 Hours
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 8, 12, and 24 hours post first dose
secondary_outcome.description: Time weighted average over 8 (TWA-8), 12 (TWA-12) and 24 (TWA-24) hours post first dose of study medication on Day 1. Positive TWA values represent a reduction in pain intensity

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With ≥30% and ≥50% Reduction From Baseline to Day 2 in Patient's Assessment of Pain Intensity
secondary_outcome.description: The Patient's assessment of pain was assessed by completion of the following 5 point scale: My pain over the past 24 hours has been: None (0), Mild (1), Moderate, (2), Severe (3), and Extreme (4).

secondary_outcome.measure: Participant's Assessment of Pain Intensity for the Average Pain Intensity at Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: The participant's assessment of pain was assessed by completion of the following 5 point scale: My pain has been: None (0), Mild (1), Moderate, (2), Severe (3), and Extreme (4).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change From Baseline in the Patient's Assessment of Pain Intensity for the Average Pain Intensity on Days 2-4, Days 2-8 and Days 2-13
secondary_outcome.description: The participant's assessment of pain was assessed by completion of the following 5 point scale: My change in pain has been: None (0), Mild (1), Moderate, (2), Severe (3), and Extreme (4). Average change over days was calculated by taking the change from Baseline to the average Pain Intensity score over the days for each patient.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Withdrawal From Treatment Due to Lack of Efficacy
secondary_outcome.description: Withdrawal due to lack of efficacy was assessed from Days 1 to 8

secondary_outcome.measure: Participants Global Evaluation of Study Medication Score
secondary_outcome.description: The participant rated the study medication that they received during the study by completing the following question: How would you rate the study medication you received for pain? 4=Excellent, 3=Good, 2=Fair, 1=Poor

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Pre-specified Gastrointestinal (GI) Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.description: The gastrointestinal tolerability was measured by incidence of moderate or severe GI adverse events (nausea, abdominal pain and dyspepsia)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Moderate or Severe Central Nervous System (CNS) Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.description: The pre-specfied CNS AEs were headache, nausea, dizziness, vertigo, vomiting and somnolence.

intervention.description: indomethacin 50 mg three times a day (TID) for 8 days.
An initial dose of celecoxib 800 mg followed by a second dose of 400 mg 12 hours later on Day 1 (celecoxib 800/400 mg regimen) and continuing 400 mg two times a day (BID) for 7 days.
An initial dose of celecoxib 400 mg followed by a second dose of 200 mg 12 hours later (celecoxib 400/200 mg regimen) and continuing 200 mg two times a day (BID) for 7 days.
Celecoxib 50 mg two times a day (BID) for 8 days

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 443 participants were screened, of which 402 participants were assigned to treatment and 400 received treatment. One participant (indomethacin 50 mg) was not treated as they were no longer willing to participate in the study, and one participant (celecoxib 800/400 mg) was not treated due to due to insufficient drug quantity at site.

group.title: Celecoxib 50 mg
group.description: Participants received Celecoxib 50 mg twice daily for 8 days

group.title: Celecoxib 400/200 mg
group.description: An initial dose of celecoxib 400 mg followed by a second dose of 200 mg 12 hours later on Day 1 (celecoxib 400/200 mg regimen) and continuing 200 mg twice daily for 7 days.

group.title: Celecoxib 800/400 mg
group.description: An initial dose of celecoxib 800 mg followed by a second dose of 400 mg 12 hours later on Day 1 (celecoxib 800/400 mg regimen) and continuing 400 mg twice daily for 7 days.

group.title: Indomethacin 50 mg
group.description: Indomethacin 50 mg three times daily for 8 days.

group.title: Celecoxib 50 mg
group.description: Participants received Celecoxib 50 mg twice daily for 8 days

group.title: Celecoxib 400/200 mg
group.description: An initial dose of celecoxib 400 mg followed by a second dose of 200 mg 12 hours later on Day 1 (celecoxib 400/200 mg regimen) and continuing 200 mg twice daily for 7 days.

group.title: Celecoxib 800/400 mg
group.description: An initial dose of celecoxib 800 mg followed by a second dose of 400 mg 12 hours later on Day 1 (celecoxib 800/400 mg regimen) and continuing 400 mg twice daily for 7 days.

group.title: Indomethacin 50 mg
group.description: Indomethacin 50 mg three times daily for 8 days.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to Day 2 in Patient's Assessment of Pain Intensity
outcome.description: The Patient’s Pain Intensity in the Index Joint for the prior 24 hours was assessed by completion of the following 5 point scale: My pain over the past 24 hours has been: None (0), Mild (1), Moderate (2), Severe (3), or Extreme (4).
outcome.population: Intent to treat (ITT): defined to be all subjects who were randomized, took at least 1 dose of study medication and had at least one post baseline evaluation; and Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF)

group.title: Celecoxib 50 mg
group.description: Participants received Celecoxib 50 mg twice daily for 8 days

group.title: Celecoxib 400/200 mg
group.description: An initial dose of celecoxib 400 mg followed by a second dose of 200 mg 12 hours later on Day 1 (celecoxib 400/200 mg regimen) and continuing 200 mg twice daily for 7 days.

group.title: Indomethacin 50 mg

measure.title: Change From Baseline to Day 2 in Patient's Assessment of Pain Intensity
measure.description: The Patient’s Pain Intensity in the Index Joint for the prior 24 hours was assessed by completion of the following 5 point scale: My pain over the past 24 hours has been: None (0), Mild (1), Moderate (2), Severe (3), or Extreme (4).
measure.population: Intent to treat (ITT): defined to be all subjects who were randomized, took at least 1 dose of study medication and had at least one post baseline evaluation; and Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF)

analysis.groups_desc: This was the primary analysis. The analysis was conducted using analysis of covariance (ANCOVA) with randomization stratum (2 levels: monoarticular or oligoarticular) and treatment group and region as factors, and the Patient’s Assessment of Pain Intensity (for the prior 24 hours) at Baseline as a covariate.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Physician’s Assessment of the Index Joint on Days 5, 9, and 14/Early Termination: Tenderness
outcome.description: Tenderness was assessed on the basis of palpation or passive motion using a 4 point scale with the following ratings: the patient had no tenderness (0), the patient complained of pain (1), the patient complained of pain and winced (2) and the patient complained of pain, winced, and withdrew (3).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Day 5, Day 9, and Day 14/Early Termination
outcome.population: Intent to treat (defined to be all subjects who were randomized, took at least 1 dose of study medication and had at least one post baseline evaluation, ITT) and LOCF

outcome.title: Participants Global Evaluation of Study Medication Score
outcome.description: The participant rated the study medication that they received during the study by completing the following question: How would you rate the study medication you received for pain? 4=Excellent, 3=Good, 2=Fair, 1=Poor

group.title: Celecoxib 50 mg
group.description: Participants received Celecoxib 50 mg twice daily for 8 days

group.title: Celecoxib 400/200 mg
group.description: An initial dose of celecoxib 400 mg followed by a second dose of 200 mg 12 hours later on Day 1 (celecoxib 400/200 mg regimen) and continuing 200 mg twice daily for 7 days.

group.title: Celecoxib 800/400 mg
group.description: An initial dose of celecoxib 800 mg followed by a second dose of 400 mg 12 hours later on Day 1 (celecoxib 800/400 mg regimen) and continuing 400 mg twice daily for 7 days.

group.title: Indomethacin 50 mg
group.description: Indomethacin 50 mg three times daily for 8 days.

measure.title: Participants Global Evaluation of Study Medication Score
measure.description: The participant rated the study medication that they received during the study by completing the following question: How would you rate the study medication you received for pain? 4=Excellent, 3=Good, 2=Fair, 1=Poor

analysis.groups_desc: The analysis was conducted using analysis of covariance (ANCOVA) with randomization stratum (2 levels: monoarticular or oligoarticular) and treatment group as factors, and the Patient’s Assessment of Pain Intensity at Baseline as a covariate.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Pre-specified Gastrointestinal (GI) Adverse Events
outcome.description: The gastrointestinal tolerability was measured by incidence of moderate or severe GI adverse events (nausea, abdominal pain and dyspepsia)

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Moderate or Severe Central Nervous System (CNS) Adverse Events
outcome.description: The pre-specfied CNS AEs were headache, nausea, dizziness, vertigo, vomiting and somnolence.

reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Patients Global Evaluation of study medication data was collected at Day 9 only.
